forumNotes.author: bee4u
forumNotes.content:
hi i am using easy boot 5.12 to make multiboot dvd of windows xp sp3 and windows 2003 sp3   
i followed all the instruction and made the dvd but when i run dvd windows xp works fine windows 2003 not it gives this error message NTLDR is corrupt system cannot boot. i have tried many times still this message.any help   
the next question is how to add windows 7 in easy boot to make multiboot dvd such as win xp win 2003 and win 7 ..?  
kindly gurus solve this problem ..THX in advance..!

forumNotes.author: bee4u
forumNotes.content: any answer how to do it..waiting..... ![:smiling9:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/smiling9.gif)

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
My guess is that you might get more specific "easy boot" support on the "easy boot" forum:  
[http://www.ezbsystem....cgi?act=SF;f=1](http://www.ezbsystems.com/cgi-bin/ikonboard.cgi?act=SF;f=1 "External link")  

About the 2003 (SP1 and later), strangely enough the message "NTLDR *is corrupt system cannot boot* " actually means that the file "*is corrupt system cannot boot* " :wink: but obviously the file is **NOT** NTLDR but rather SETUPLDR.BIN :wink:. (the good MS guys have a special gift to make simple things either complex or plainly wrong ![:smiling9:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/smiling9.gif))  
Most probably you modified the ~~NTLDR~~ SETUPLDR.BIN without recreating the proper checksum (or used on the 2003 SP1 or later version a tool intended for the XP version that doesn't have the checksum implemented). ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

Compare with:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...sp1-winpe-2004/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/58410-solution-for-multibooting-win-xp2k3-64-bit-win2k3-sp1-winpe-2004/ "External link")  

![:blink:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/blink.png)  
Wonko
